Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Phidippus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Canal House for four nights in late March, 2012 and were very pleasantly surprised by how easy it was for us to reach wonderful restaurants and access Amsterdam by public transit. We arrived at the Central Station and it was a quick tram ride to Westerkerk which was only a block and a half away from the hotel located on a canal. Our room was in the back of the hotel and overlooked a wonderful little garden which was well kept, very private and a great place to have a coffee after breakfast. Our room was well appointed and very quiet with a good bed and bathroom. The breakfast was adequate with cereals, fruits, boiled eggs, breads, cheeses and meats, and the attendant was very prompt in filling requests for lattes or coffees of any description. With only a short reverse walk to Westerkerk we had access to the rest of the city in jig time and the hotel was only a block away from the Anne Frank House. On our first afternoon we were returning from a short walk and found the Anne Frank House almost empty. After purchasing a Museeumkart, we walked right in. The Museeumkart also gave us access to many more of the prime museums throughout the Netherlands and allowed us to skip ticket lines to get right into them. We visited the Rijksmuseeum, the Van Gogh Museum, Nemo, the Royal Palace, the Amsterdam Museum and would have visited the Contemporary Art Museum if it was not being renovated during our visit. It truly was a card that both saved a lot of money and time if visiting attractions is what you want to do. Some of those ticket lines looked quite formidable. Check out that card on the Internet to see its value and then purchase one at any of the museums. It is good for one year! The bathroom has wonderful lotions, shampoos and soaps which my wife enjoyed very much. I enjoyed the shower which was a great drench and certainly made you feel you were standing under a waterfall. All in all, a great stay and one we would vsit again.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated small luxuries make this special”
Reviews.Author: LisaSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Amsterdam was only overnight as we were passing through--so we wanted to maximize our few hours there. Sandwiched between two canals, we chose the Canal House for the sophistication of its color scheme and location (and an in-house dining room). Upon an early arrival, we were allowed to drop (numerous) bags in the small bar and were ushered into the dining room--empty--but they rustled up a sandwhich and drinks for us. The dining room is (again) absolutely beautiful, with inverted porcelain lamp shades filled with creamy flowers. Very unusual, and the product of a neighborhood artisan. We did have to carry our bags up winding, steep, and narrow stairs, but we knew going in that the hotel was in an older renovated building. The room (their least expensive, although that is relative) was small, spotless, and luxurious in color and bath amenities and linens. It was a block walk to a primary church, the Anne Frank House (don't miss), and the first homosexual monument, and a longer but still comfortable walking distance (maybe 20 blocks?) from the City Historical Museum (don't miss). We had plenty of time to enjoy all of these activities,as well as walking along the canals, before returning to the hotel for dinner. We were exhausted and it was lovely indeed to simply return to the hotel dining room for what was really a fine meal. Breakfast early the next morning was adequate--and the beautiful room started the day off right. The hotel called the cab and they were there almost immediately. Very convenient. We did feel that the hotel was maybe hosting a version of _______'s Next Top Model. Lot's of young, skinny and very hip young women--but there were also business folks, a family, and others. If you like grey, black and purple--you will love this hotel. Check the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “chic stay on the canal”
Reviews.Author: bruce m
Reviews.Content: visited here for 4 nites july 2011. excellent hotel. great staff, location, decor. superb. this is a not miss. found on internet and loved it...opened round april 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, charming, not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: MMPJ1956
Reviews.Content: We "upgraded" to an "exceptional" room, and it WAS (although it was not cheap). The canal view and bed superb. Staff very kind and helpful. Location excellent. highly recommended. Will return. Need we say more.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richspence
Reviews.Content: As a newly married couple we decided on a short break to Amsterdam after our wedding. We arrived at the canal house and were greeted by a very friendly member of staff. We were offered a room upgrade for a very small charge an were then lead to the best room at the hotel. It was stunning! For the three day stay the staff could not do enough for us and on our second day we were given breakfast room service free of charge. Would highly recommend to any one. Beautiful hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel built in an old canal house but entirely refurbished with design wooden furniture. Full of charm and conveniently located a stone's throw from the "negen straatjes" (the nine little streets known for their charming shops) and Anne Frank's house. The quality of the amenities and the service are impeccable, and all add to a very pleasant experience whether on a business or leisure trip. I highly recommend Canal House.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Anturix
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days in the beginning of January. Very stylish hotel with friendly staff, comfortable rooms, tasty breakfasts, convenient location. No one negative thing to say.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely redesigned hotel”
Reviews.Author: slairson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best room which was basically a canal view suite on the top floor. First the downsides: = The room is laid out quite strangely - very long. = The drain in the shower was clogged, which for some reason I didn't complain about till our stay was half over. The room would fill with water every time we showered. Once I did mention something it was fixed straight away. = The heating system was changed mid-week and we couldn't figure out how to heat the room properly (and neither could Housekeeping). = The staff was nice, but far too apologetic. I would prefer something to be done rather than you just apologizing why it isn't being done. = Very poor dinner service. Very expensive wines, uber fishy fish, and ridiculously undercooked beef. And nothing was even done to adjust the very expensive bill after we complained. The upsides: = The hotel is gorgeous!! = Morning breakfast and restaurant area is perfect to wake up to. We were able to have breakfast brought to us one morning and it was the best. = Room service was wonderful. = Super comfy bed and fabulous canal views. = Great turndown service with little snacks left every few nights. = Communication with the hotel via email prior to our arrival was always prompt and thorough. = The hotel is gorgeous!! We visit Amsterdam every year and I think this is the newest and most modern hotel in the Jordaan. We are already planning on returning this year.

Reviews.Title: “DINNER”
Reviews.Author: Shane A
Reviews.Content: A wonderful looking hotel in an excellent area. Much time and money has been spent making this a great looking hotel. I and 4 other friends decided to eat dinner there last week. As we arrived two Italian diners were complaining of the food but we remained to see for ourselves. We ordered our drinks and two courses. The starter arrived but they forgot one of our number and had to go away to re-order it from the kitchen. The Pate was tasteless according to one friend, but the others were satisfied with their food. We waited and waited for our next course and I could see that the waiters were tucking into our chips whilst they waited for the course to arrive. Really not good enough for a hotel of this supposed standard. I and my friends will not be going back - there are other equally good hotels near by in which to stay and eat in.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kma1984
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Even the breakfast was wonderful. This was my 4th time in Amsterdam and I would definitely stay in the Canal House again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings ...”
Reviews.Author: Linne-B
Reviews.Content: I came away with mixed feelings ... We booked 2 rooms with canal views but ended up with NO view at all other than the walls of a light shaft about 1 meter away from the window.The windows only opened out about 10 cm which made the rooms very claustrophobic and the airco didn't work. The receptionist's rather displaced sense of humor certainly did not put a smile on our face when, pointing to the old black and white picture in the light shaft, she said: "But you do have a canal view!" Such behavior is quite disrespectful to guests paying 320â‚¬ (+tax) per room per night. This issue was raised on our departure and we were offered the dinner we had on the night we dined in. The receptionist also apologized for her misplaced joke. We had room 6 which could only be reached by walking through the open kitchen and room 19, reachable by a neck breaking winding staircase. Both are so called "better rooms". The rooms themselves were quite nice, excellent Vi-Spring mattresses and soft bed sheets, enough towels and a bathrobe. Both had open bathrooms & separate toilets, tiny basins, good shower... no privacy though! The breakfast included in the price was a very meager buffet indeed: matured & young cheese slices (you'd expect more of a country known for its cheeses!) & some smoked ham, a selection of yoghurt, jam, bread, some danishes (if you were early enough to get some), cereal & fruit juice. Anything from the kitchen (eggs etc) was an extra charge. The staff serving breakfast (with the exception of a helpful young man) was rather loud and not discrete at all. The lady cook who came to our table even made some lengthy remark about supplements she saw beside my plate! So overall this is a very well located and beautiful boutique hotel but its standard unfortunately does not compare to its price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: whylion
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Canal House in November. We had a "great" room overlooking the garden on the third floor (#17-we asked for a canal view but were told it was unavailable) and my daughter had a "good" room also overlooking the back garden on the second floor (#10). They were both nice -- room 10 had a higher ceiling and original windows, while room 17 was larger. The rooms were kind of dark, as the walls are essentially black, which got a little dreary in November. There aren't a lot of light fixtures, but there is a good reading light by the bed. There was supposed to be a ipod dock that was missing in room 17, but we didn't need it so didn't ask reception about it. The toiletries are very nice, although they only gave us one tiny bar of soap and never replaced it even after it got down to a tiny chip. It was hard to control the room temperature - either too cold or too hot. We really liked the restaurant and ate dinner there twice. The breakfast buffet was a little small compared to other hotels we have stayed in. The only fruit is a kind of sad fruit salad, and eggs and smoked salmon cost extra. There were no pancakes or waffles to be had. The service was fast and friendly, and we felt comfortable and welcome. We loved the bar and had drinks there most evenings. The location is wonderful, away from some of the grunge of the downtown area. It's near the "9 streets" shopping area as well as the Jordaan which are fun places to walk and shop. There are a lot of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. All in all we would stay at the canal house again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki-Mic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend at hotel Canal House in Amsterdam. The hotel is a nice and small boutique hotel with only 22 rooms. The personnel was very friendly and kind. I.e. they suggested and helped us with buying tickets to the Anne Frank museum online, so we didn't need to queue. The location of the hotel is great! Everything on a walking distance. The room was cool with a bath tube in the middle of the room. It was a bit dark with a lot of black and purple colours. Different, but cool. They had free wlan everywhere. The restaurant was really good. We had a late arrival on Friday night and had dinner there, it was a nice surprise! Actually the best food that weekend :) Breakfast was small but okay, great coffee! I would stay here again and can recommend the hotel for couples and business people. The hotel belongs to the chain "small luxury hotels".

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location & boutique luxury”
Reviews.Author: MitchSinclair
Reviews.Content: The Canal House was a dream. From the swank designer magazines you can peruse in the lounge to the pristine and decadent rooms (including a sexy in-room soaking tub!), this amazing hotel pleased both the graphic designer in me and the vintage-seeking oldschooler. With windows that opened right up to the canal, and a location filled with "real amsterdamers" and incredible restaurants, I couldn't imagine anything more delightful. We feel in love.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and modern”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyandCorey
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here. The buffet breakfast was included in our room price and it was quite complete. We had a nice room that looked exactly like the picture on the website. This hotel has a good location, but it is a bit of a walk into the "heart" of Amsterdam (15-20 minutes depending on your pace). For us this was perfect as we like to walk and we value a quiet hotel experience. Definitely eat dinner at de struisvogel, which is just a short walk from the hotel (de struisvogel means ostrich in Dutch, it's their specialty and it's delicious!.

Reviews.Title: “Old Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: harrybBunbury
Reviews.Content: The property is in a great position .On arrival for a 7 day stay we were shown several rooms and found the first two offered either too small (3) or basically below ground (7) we settled for a rear facing 5th floor (17) that was lovely ,although there was a high frequency electrical background noise that they could not fix. Why do most hotels try to sell the worst rooms first ? We were offered another more expensive room @ 525 Euro but considered that 400 Euro a night was well and truly enough. We commented to management and were informed that hotel prices in Amsterdam were very high ? I believe there are better value options in Amsterdam $$'s aren't everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to like it, but was only okay...”
Reviews.Author: Evergrande
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here after one night at the newly renovated De L'Europe hotel. There, we were upgraded to a suite and the facilities were really top notch. Classy facade paired with cool modern interior touches. Ipads in every room. Then we moved to Canal House with great expectations. Positive FT article etc. We booked a "good room" and were upgraded to a "better room". Problem was the "better room" they showed us was terrible! Tiny, with a view on construction in the inner courtyard. When we complained they showed us another tiny room that faced a wall maybe 3 feet from the window. Basically we had to pay up for a higher category room that overlooked the canal. (The lady manager also kinda tricked us. Said it was eur 100 to the next category and that she would only charge us eur 50. It was actually only eur 40 difference when we checked later. Whatever.) Other weird points. You have to walk through the kitchen to get to certain rooms. And climb lots of steep stairs for others. Then the coup de grace. After we checked out, they emailed to tell us they charged eur 22 for some minibar item we didn't buy. Annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in great location...”
Reviews.Author: TonykingB2
Reviews.Content: Wonderful amenities, VERY friendly and helpful staff, English speaking....the hotel had the feel of a bed & breakfast. Very comfortable beds, excellent rainforest style shower heads. Location is wonderful, only a 15 minute walk to city center, and a 20 minute walk to Vondelpark/Leidsplein area.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel and superb restaurant!!”
Reviews.Author: trentmum63
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. It is very stylish, with luxurious fixtures and fittings. Pure white, crisp bedlinen, gorgeous bathrooms, high levels of cleanliness, excellent buffet breakfast including choice of hot food prepared to order. We arrived quite early, at 10am, following a very early morning flight. As expected, our room wasn't ready, but we were able to leave our case. The receptionist took our number and phoned us - within an hour - to say our room was ready. On our return to the hotel, our bags had already been put in our room. What excellent service!! The staff were charming and very helpful, and nothing was too much trouble. We decided to have an evening meal in the restaurant and it was one of the best meals we have eaten in a long time, comparable with the food in our favourite Michelin starred restaurant in England. If you stay here, may I recommend that you have at least one dinner in the hotel, as to miss it would be a real shame. I honestly cannot recommend this hotel, and its restaurant, highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairenz50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Canal House Hotel a few times in the past and loved it. Hence my desire to return in September 2011. My first stay at the newly renovated and owned hotel. It was very impressive in not only the decor but the level of service which is greatly improved from previous ownership. My baggage was taken to my room for me, which was greatly appreciated because of narrow staircases in the hotel. I was escorted to my room by the lady who checked me in, who also carried my hand luggage for me, and she proceeded to explain all about it. Some of the old charm has been retained, notably in my bedroom, the floor had a slope, but that's part of being in a refurbished canal house. It was also good to know that the restaurant is now open for all meals, whereas previously only breakfast was available. Plus there is now room service, which wasn't available previously. The room I stayed in, classified as a "good" room, I believe, was extremely comfortable, with very generous wardrobes and the bathroom was very well appointed. Air conditioning/heating was a welcome addition, which together with the IPod docking station and large flat-screen TV plus DVD player brought it right up to date technologically, as well as the fact that there is free Wi-Fi. I found my room to be very good value for money, since the breakfast was also included in the room rate. The breakfast was quite adequate and a hungry man would have no problem filling up and being satisfied for the rest of the morning. I found the staff to be very friendly and eager to please, nothing was too much trouble for them. I had dinner in the restaurant on my first evening, and found the food to be excellent, well prepared and presented and good value for money in a restaurant of its calibre. I love the location of the hotel on the canal, and its proximity to both the centre of the city - the Dam square - and the central station, a delightful walk through the old streets to reach either of these. It was altogether a very good experience and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, cozy, and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay T
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely one-night stay at Canal House for a quick weekend trip to Amsterdam. It was the perfect place to stay - the location couldn't be any better. The place is in the middle of the Jordaan neighborhood, which is full of adorable cafes and shops, but it's walking distance from the train station and all the tourist attractions. Our room was very comfortable and stylish, with a nice assortment of magazines and good bath products. The one downside was that our window faced a wall, but we didn't care since we weren't going to be spending much time in the room. We had a nice breakfast the next morning overlooking the garden. Overall, a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous staff, interesting rooms”
Reviews.Author: wbdog50
Reviews.Content: We were just off the plane from the US, and after a short ride from the airport, arranged by Canal House, we found a delightful set of row houses converted into a wonderful hotel. Rooms are a bit quirky, with the bathtub often in the room, but the staff is attentive, the bar (located with reception) is fun, and the food is good. Location is central, close by the Anne Frank house.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel for the discerning traveller”
Reviews.Author: GogglesMan
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and stay mostly at chain hotels (Sheratons etc) so for our holiday wanted a more personal, boutique experience. We found this hotel online, it had great reviews and in person did not disappoint. Our room was beautifully decorated and appointed, very tasteful and elegant. Service was excellent, the staff were very helpful. Breakfast was fabulous with traditional Dutch bread/cheese/ham in addition to cereals or hot breakfast. All delicious. Location was excellent, quiet canal surrounded by great shops and restaurants. If there is a downside, is that I wish the air conditioning in the room was better, but definitely not a turn off. Recommend this hotel for a sumptuous stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tanja027
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at Canal House and it was fantastic!!! It was a great location being one street away from Anne Frank House also a short walk from Dam Square and The Nine Streets. Everything we needed was close. The hotel was very boutique style having been recently renovated so it was super clean. The breakfast was delicious but mostly the staff were fabulous. Nothing was too much to ask and everyone from the receptionist to the restaurant staff to the cleaner was SO nice. Thanks Canal House for making our stay so great. We'll definately see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Excellent Boutique Hotel, I Found By Accident”
Reviews.Author: jazzbeezy
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I had to fly out to Amsterdam on a couple of day's notice for a film shoot last week. Had no clue where to stay, or what part of town or what our options might be. Found The Canal House mostly by accident while poking around a couple of boutique hotel sites (Tablet, I believe). Intrigued by the pictures, and the simplicity of their room tiers (Good, Better, Best). Didn't have high expectations for whatever reason, particularly since we were going to be in Amsterdam for work and not on vacation. But stayed 3 nights there and, well, it was an all around surprisingly excellent experience. Hotel is located in Jordaan neighborhood and it's nearby the tourist magnets of the Red Light District and the Anne Frank House (just around the corner), and some other smaller attractions. But it's just far away from everything that you don't feel suffocated by it. It feels residential and local for the most part, but still close enough to access the tourist stuff if you want. Hotel itself is a narrow building about 4 stories high. Has 20-25 rooms total, but it feels like less. It's a little cramped and narrow inside (especially the stairs - there's no elevator either), but I got the sense that a lot of buildings along the canals in Amsterdam are like that. It was part of the local charm. Garden in the back is beautiful and worth hanging out in. Black and purple decor inside is executed well, as was overall design touches in the rooms and throughout the building. Simple and thoughtful and done well. Didn't eat in the restaurant while we were there but it's apparently a well-regarded dining option in town, as often it had many tables occupied by non-guests for lunch and dinner. Hotel staff was very friendly. Very accommodating. Made the experience personal - everyone would learn your name. But it wasn't ever creepy or insincere, and they didn't ever overdo it like some places do. Found this to be a real part of the overall pleasant stay we had. I had a "Better Room" (the medium sized one) and it was a touch smaller than I expected for the price (and from the photos). But it was still comfortable and convenient. Was space for my stuff and for me to work. Wireless internet is free for guests, and it could have been faster. But it wasn't terrible. Better than most boutique places I've stayed in before. There were a lot of couples staying at the hotel while we were there. It's a romantic hotel but still a place you can stay at if you're looking for something different on your work trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Franz21
Reviews.Content: Canal House was recently renovated and we felt they did a great job in making a very contemporary hotel still feel firmly anchored to its history and traditions: cosmopolitan boutique hotel features are cleverly mixed with very "dutch" pieces â€“ from paintings to porcelain statues - making it unique. The restaurant area and the bar are sophisticated and cosy â€“ definitely worth a visit. The rooms are exactly as you see them on the website: modern, glamorous and sleek. Felt luxurious, definitely - with every comfort you would expect from a hotel of this category. The location is brilliant - close enough to walk everywhere and sufficiently far away from the 'tourist traps' of the city centre. Jordaan itself is a charming neighbourhood with lots of great restaurants, bars and shops. I would highlight some small, but nice, touches: daily weather forecast on the bedside table; excellent complimentary wi-fi; high-end magazines in the room; high quality toiletries; very good complimentary breakfast... the list could go on. Last but not least, the service: impeccable, from front desk to the bar and restaurant. They assisted us with everything we needed and made us feel very welcome throughout. A perfect hotel for romantic escapes, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: antigua-jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in June for a mix of business and pleasure and cannot fault the location, facilities or service at this hotel. The location is absolutely perfect - in the prettiest part of the city with many bars and restaurants all within a very short walk. A very easy stroll right into the centre, and a very welcome short hop back out of it again! There are some great places to eat and drink in the Jordaans area and the restaurant at the Canal House is definately amongst them with a great menu and beautiful setting with impeccable service. We had a mix-up with our room, and after an inital few words the management resolved this quickly and very fairly for us. The room itself was lovely - we ended up in one of the smaller rooms and it was perfect for a weekend away. I'd advise triple checking exactly what you are going to be getting in the room you book to avoid confusion but otherwise perfect! We had a great stay at the Canal House - a perfect blend of functionality and style. We will definately return next time we are back in the beautiful city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in a convenient spot by the canals”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne09
Reviews.Content: It's a relatively new hotel, by the canal, about 15 minute walk from the Central Station. Renovated old canal house.Gorgeous rooms, in a modern style, though they've kept some of the old features. We had an attic room done in black and purple. Very comfortable big bed. Wifi available throughout hotel. Yummy breakfast included in the tariff. Dinner was good too we tried that one night. Staff friendly and helpful. Easy access to around central Amsterdam yet in a nice area. Will stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charm”
Reviews.Author: rub14
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff; went out of their way to take care of things. Looked over a pretty canal; around the corner from the Anne Frank House; easy to walk to everything else. Very good complimentary breakfast. Narrow halls and steep stairs (there is an elevator), but to us, that adds to the charm of these combined 17th century merchant houses.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room overlooking the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Zebra3719
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Canal House. The room was AMAZING: great linens, fabulous bed, great bathroom - smallish but otherwise the room felt like 5 star luxury. The vibe was very contemporary and spa-like. I loved the products in the bathroom offered in full-sized bottles. The lighting in the room was super high tech and really contributed to the mood. The staff was extremely professional and helpful. We recommend the Canal House with great enthusiasm!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Global_Nomadista
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here 2 week ago. We were in Amsterdam for a romantic getaway. While the bed was comfortable and the toiletries were great quality and nice, the overall experience was totally disappointing! First, my husband surprised me by ordering beautiful roses and truffles - however, the roses wilted after ONE day :( . But the really big problem occurred on the second night - we were awoken at 6 am by loud noises in our room. We called reception and they said they would check into it - nothing at all improved and the noise continued. We tried to sleep unsuccessfully for the next 1.5 hrs at which point, frustrated and exhausted, we called again. This time they offered to move us to another room. We moved but in that room we were AGAIN unable to sleep because it faced the garden and there were workers banging away very loudly!!! ;(( Anyway, we missed breakfast (supposedly included) due to this debacle and when my husband went to pay, they took a measly 50 euro off the bill. SUPER LAME! No offer of a complimentary night / a meal (we were not only tired but now, starving). Overall, the service was VERY disappointing (not from everyone but the guy we dealt with the most was just 'blah') and I would NOT recommend staying here. I had such high hopes for you, Canal House. I'm bummed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: CosimoPiovasco
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this newly refurbished hotel and had a wonderful time there. Our room, which was very bright and faced the canal, gave us a gorgeous view. When we arrived, we did have to carry our bags up the short flight of about 5 stairs from the street but after that, our bags were left at reception and we were shown up to our room by a very friendly member of staff and our bags arrived later. It is obvious that design played a very large part in the renovation of the hotel and it appears to have had a successful outcome, both aesthetically and mostly functionally. The restaurant within the hotel was a hidden gem. The menu was small but what was served was excellent and fresh. In fact, we cancelled our reservation at another restaurant one evening as we figured it didn't make sense to go out for food when there was such wonderful food right under our roof. Some people may dislike being made to walk through a restaurant's kitchen to go anywhere, but I like it. It gives me the opportunity to make a quick inspection of the general condition of the kitchen, the staff working in it etc, and it also told me that the chef was not afraid to open his kitchen up for inspection. It was a lovely white clean and bright kitchen. Breakfast was a favourite time for us every day as we had it in bed with the morning sun shining in with the wonderful canal view in front of us. The bar was small and neat and shared the space with reception. The atmosphere around the bar at night was lovely, helped significantly by the presence of experienced and charming bar staff. Thankfully our experience at the hotel was tranquil and we never had any disturbed sleep. I suppose in a small hotel, it boils down to luck of the draw sometimes. In general, the staff of the hotel were all very friendly, approachable and helpful. We had a marvellous long weekend in Amsterdam, due largely to our experience at Canal House!

Reviews.Title: “stylish place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: somersetfoodie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful modern hotel in a great location overlooking the canal, ideal for exploring Amsterdam. The hotel had been recently renovated when we stayed for a couple of days, and the designer decor is modern and luxurious. Staff were friendly and very efficient. Great place for a romantic treat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic second honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SantodaSerra
Reviews.Content: A surprise from my husband ....so I was a bit apprehensive about his solo choice of hotel, but lo and behold was very pleasantly surprised. Canal House was a superb choice, our room looked onto the canal which was a treat. Food was excellent and we found the staff friendly and accommodating without getting too over the top. It has lots of personal touches like the photos and music which is very trendy, decoration is also top class. We cycled all over the city, and Amsterdam is so full of things to do and see that IÂ´m sure we will be back at Canal House soon.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: bmenno
Reviews.Content: We just had diner there last night, and enjoyed it so much that it deserves a review. At the moment one of the best restaurants in Amsterdam in its price range. Service is very professional, and attentive. There is a la carte but we took a 3 course menu for 36,- euro. For quality of the food, a gift. After haven the biggest amuse I ever had (almost like a starter), we had two starters: one a scottish lobster, and second a sea bass. The main course was dutch lamb with white asparagus. It all was perfectly cooked. I will come back soon and let my friends taste the quality of the food. Since the place is quite new not a lot of people know about it yet. It won't take before the do!

Reviews.Title: “A horrible hotel and a poor first impression of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: WMuirhead-100
Reviews.Content: We initially booked this hotel because of its ratings in TripAdvisor and as a Small Luxury Hotel of the World site. It was not a luxurious but was small and was a hotel. Upon arriving at 730 pm we were greeted at reception after carrying our own bags up the front stairs with an indifferent receptionist. After 10 minutes looking for our confirmed reservation we were required to 1) carry our bags up two flights of stairs, 2) pull our bags through the dinning room and KITCHEN!, and three when presented with our room told little about its operation or amenities. The room was small and dark. There was construction in the back garden throughout our first day. Most concerning is that the hotel seems to cater to young guests who return late in the evening or early morning to continue their evening activities in what can only be described as dorm like sound proofing. Many guests while were there complained. Breakfast consisted of a small buffet breakfast with eggs cooked upon request. In most cases little fruit and no cereal was provided as part of the buffet although this was part of the hotel's selling point. In short I cannot recommend this hotel for its service, its accommodations, or its breakfast. We left after two nights for a true five star hotel. This should be rated as a two star hotel at best!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizP1055
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the Canal House. The staff was friendly and attentive and our room was beautiful, comfortable and very well-appointed. The location was perfect - close to most attractions, great restaurants and most importantly - it was quiet! Compared to other hotels in Amsterdam I considered this to be a great deal as the room was newly renovated and breakfast was included in the rate. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved it loved it”
Reviews.Author: Warrington_UKVicky
Reviews.Content: Fabulously stylish hotel, only just re-opened after a major renovation. In a great location along one of the major canals, Keizersgracht, walking distance from the centre of the city, the main railway station (about 15 mins) and, most importantly, loads of great cafes, restaurants and lovely shops. Room was perfect, even though we went for the cheapest one called 'good'. Bed was soooo lovely, great bathroom. Everything spotless. When the garden is open in a few weeks it will be even better. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, nothing was too much trouble and we had none of those grudging 'okay's that you get in other hotels, including our late check out request. They really made us feel wanted and not a bit of a nuisance, as some other hotels do. A really lovely place, with fabulous staff. Defintely number 1 in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Phooved
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be in Amsterdam on a pleasure/business trip and had our reservations booked for us. What a wonderful experience it was! This is a totally first class hotel with all the attendant ammenities! As a bonus, it overlooks a canal and is within walking distance to everything in downtown Amsterdam. The room was very comfortable, the staff was amazingly helpful, the food was great! Do NOT miss eating dinner at the hotel--the food is gourmet and worth staying in for! If you are looking for total comfort and an amazing hotel experience in Amsterdam, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new design hotel with outstanding service & restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: RaymondJoore
Reviews.Content: Had drinks & dinner with clients in this beautiful new design hotel on a stunning location in Amsterdam. The service and quality of food was very good. I actually didn't have such a good dinner experience in Amsterdam for a long time. My spoiled French - gourmand - client was also very impressed. Nice place for just a cocktail too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic hotel with the perfect amount of Amsterdam charm”
Reviews.Author: LuluMyers
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with wonderful staff, just all round lovely, would definitely stay again. We arrived late and the reception staff were very helpful in suggesting multiple dinner options for us, they provided a map and directions and personal recommendations. This may seem simple customer service but I have travelled enought to know that good customer service is extremely rare. Such a great location, easy to walk around and get a great feel for Amsterdam despite our very short stay. Very disappointed to see it is now closed for renovations as I found out when I went to book a return visit. Can't imagine what they are doing to improve? I certainly hope the hotel does not loose any of it's charm as a result of it's change of ownership and renovations

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cozy, just what I like.”
Reviews.Author: PeggyGMinneapolis_MN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Canal House possibly 4 times in the past seven years and loved it each time. The dining room is just lovely and the breakfast was always more than adequate. We always like when the ladies that served us called us "love", expecially the husbands liked it. . At present I am waitng to be able to book for Sept. 2009 and am quite worried that the remodel and new owners will price the Canal House out of my range. I have stayed at the Toren just a few door further up the street and after their remodel the price skyrocketed out of my league. This was my home away from home and I sure want to be able to return. The former staff couldn't be improved upon so I hope they take good advise and hire the same caliber of people. Here's hoping I can afford to come back and all is as charming and cozy as I remember.

Reviews.Title: “Farewell Canal House, you'll be missed”
Reviews.Author: Blob
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my wife at the Canal House and found my perfect Amsterdam hotel - only to discover that it's been sold and shuts down for 9 months on 3rd May for a total refurbishment and all the staff have been laid off. No matter how much the new owners spend I can't imagine them improving on what we found as part of the charm of the place is that it has no airs and graces, is very relaxed and the staff, who we found all to be helpful & friendly,even though they would lose there jobs in a week,have been there years. We had a superior room with canal view which was quite a good size for Amsterdam as was the bathroom. Breakfast (included) was typical with fruit, breads, cheeses and cold meats and was always fresh & plentiful - even if arriving late. The various receptionists were always helpful. The small bar (manned by the receptionist) was handy to meet friends for a pre-dinner drink. The location is the best/quieiest I've stayed in Amsterdam. I've stayed at the Seven Bridges which is fine but this place beats it on location, room size and having the small bar/reception area where you can meet other guests. I'll probably give the 'new' hotel a try when it re-opens just because I loved the old one so much. If they have managed to improve on it, it will be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel like stepping back in time!”
Reviews.Author: kazzavan
Reviews.Content: It took us a while to find the hotel in the dark so I would recommend a good map, but it was certainly worth it! We had a lovely welcome despite it being late in the evening and from the moment we opened the substantial front door it was like stepping back into another age! Our room was furnished with beautiful antiques but despite feeling you were in a different century the fittings and fixtures were definitely 21st Century with a Villeroy Boch fitted bathroom suite, designer toiletteries and satellite TV in the room. The breakfast room again was elegantly fitted with a grand piano in the middle of the room and relaxing classical music playing - the choice was good for continental breakfast and was certainly a good start to the day. Would definitely recommend this hotel to couples looking for somewhere romantic, although I would be nervous of taking younger children with all the delicately balanced antiques!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: verntern
Reviews.Content: The Canal House Hotel is an elegant, beautifully furnished, small hotel in an ideal part of central Amsterdam. Within easy walking distance for public transport and many tourist attractions, yet in a quiet canalside street. We were nicely welcomed and offered a choice of two rooms. Our room was clean and comfortable and overlooked the garden which must be delightful in the summer months. This hotel is certainly different from the usual large hotel chains with boxes pretending to be rooms! Criticisms? Yes, it was expensive for a three night stay. Especially as one of our nights was a Sunday when there were not many guests and it was the Winter season. No discounts were offered. Breakfast on the Saturday morning was reasonably fine when the hotel was busy and there were an adequate number of staff. Bowls of fruit straight out of a tin though? Fresh fruit doesn't cost so much more! The following two mornings went downhill for service and food running out. At our last breakfast I was continually visiting the kitchen to ask for things and almost donned an apron to get things moving! Canal House Hotel, if you are employing foreign workers give them more training in understanding what guests are asking for. Apart from that, a lovely experience to stay here and this hotel is recommended to anyone who wants something elegant, surprises around every corner in its decor and in the heart of Amsterdam. One other must do is to have dinner at the restaurant 'Lieve'. Just a short walk away. An amazing dining experience. Not to be missed! We loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kingkelly77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is set on one of the beautiful canals about 10minutes from Central Station. The two scottish ladies (i think they were scottish) couldn't have been more helpful. I had a lovely double room, very spacious with flat screen TV and a huge white marble bathroom (room 19). Breakfast was served in the most amazing lounge, very smartly laid out with grand piano taking centre stage. I wasnt offered a cooked breakfast but i was more than happy with the buffet selection on offer. Great hotel, great location and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Delightful”
Reviews.Author: auDubon331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, older travelers, stayed at the Canal House for a week in October. We prefer hotels with some personality as opposed to the sterile, impersonal atmosphere of the large chains. The Canal House was perfect. The staff was accommodating and friendly, the breakfast (and the breakfast room!) was marvelous. Our room was large, comfortable and overlooked the garden. The location is within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to see in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Canal House for 3 nights in November of 2007. It is in a wonderful location. It's owners are very genial and helpful. It is easily walkable from Centraal Station if you are reasonably healthy and your luggage rolls well on cobblestones. Please be advised that the rooms do not contain a television set, so if you wear yourself out during the day and expect to relax watching TV in the evening, it is not an option. The breakfast was great and the staff helpful and friendly with the exception of one of the people at the front desk we nicknamed Frau Bleuker. Maybe she was just not having a good day that day. The rooms were very basic but clean. I have mixed feelings about the Canal House but I would stay again if the price were a little better. I would recommend it highly if you like and are familiar with the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: halcyon_days
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Amsterdam many times for business and short breaks. This was our first stay at this hotel and we were not disappointed. The location is convenient, views from the rooms over the canal were lovely, breakfast excellent.Free wifi, hairdryer, small desk area. Rooms were not very large and small storage space but good for short break. They do have one lift but bear in mind it is a traditional canalhouse, getting to some rooms involve walking upstairs with luggage as the lift does not go to all sections of the house.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BowenLinda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in October on our first visit to Amsterdam. After exploring Amsterdam we felt the hotel's location in the Jordaan was the best locale for us: quiet, great architecture, terrific bars and restaurants close by and very much an Amsterdamer neighbourhood. We walked everywhere. We had room #14 on the third floor overlooking the Keizersgracht canal. Nightly charge was E150. Brick walls, beamed ceiling, 1 set of French doors and another door opening over the canal (no balcony). Marble bathroom with enclosed shower, comfortable bed, all in all a lovely room. Note: steeeeep stairs! The elevator did not go to our floor so if a visitor had mobility issues, this is not the room for her. A modest quibble: this is a three star hotel yet did not have a bar fridge. We really enjoyed this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some small problems !”
Reviews.Author: AlanLee
Reviews.Content: It is with some regret that I write this review. I have stayed at the Canal House 6 times in the past 10 years- the rooms are great (well the ones that I always request are). Housekeeping can be hit and miss - for 2 days running the shower gel was not replaced. I had to ask reception to replace it (exactly the same thing happened last year). The bath mat was taken away and not replaced, I had to ask reception before it was brought back. Reception staff - Janice you are great, however, the lady with the long ginger hair is extremely aloof. If you are bored by being asked the same question 1000 times then you really should think about changing jobs, we were not rude to you and you were not rude to us but your body language said everything. Mary (she is the owner) please please take note even my partner noticed the above and commented that maybe we should consider staying elsewhere next year. This comment is coming from one of your regular clients so it really is in your interest to iron these problems out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous001
Reviews.Content: The Canal House has a great location - it was easy to walk to all the places that we wanted to see or to grab quick transportation. As you might guess, it's right along the canals. It's in a nice neighborhood with some unique shops and restaurants nearby. As for the hotel itself, it has alot of antique-decor. The room we had was very small for two people to negotiate. I thought it was a nice place to stay and charming, but probably would choose to stay somewhere a little more "hip" next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved the Canal House!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuCastoway
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, friendly, helpful staff, clean, LOVED THE MORNING BREAKFASTS overlooking the garden. Hope to stay there again someday...

Reviews.Title: “Character, charm, friendliness - and antiques.”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Canal House Hotel on Keizergracht for 5 nights in June and we can truthfully say that every aspect of our time there was a pleasure. It is in a quiet location yet only minutes from most things you are likely to want to visit. The rooms are all very individual - ours was at the top of the building with a splendidly refurbished bathroom, lots of antiques and easy chairs in which to relax. The whole place has charm and old-world style in abundance. Breakfast (a buffet including fruits, cold meats, cheeses and a variety of breads) is taken in a stately room full of atmosphere and overlooking the gardens. Wonderful! There is also an intimate bar (where you can check your e-mails if you must on the communal computer). The staff were universally great. Receptionists were constantly there with advice and help - and happy to make calls for us if needed. They could not have been more welcoming. Perhaps the only warning is that, even with the lift, there can be occasional stairs to negotiate. Overall - highly recommended for those seeking peace and quiet in a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Stay on the Canal”
Reviews.Author: monarchtravel
Reviews.Content: My family of three loved The Canal House Hotel. What a charming place to stay and a wonderful change from the large chain hotels! We had a large triple room with newly remodeled bathroom which included a large tub and free standing shower. Lovely view over the gardens which was extremely quiet and ideal for sleeping. Great location within walking distance of anywhere we wanted to go including great pubs and restaurants, yet off the noisy main streets. I wouldn't stay any where else while in Amsterdam. My only issue might be that the carpet in our room should be replaced to make it a top notch room.

Reviews.Title: “Old-world elegance”
Reviews.Author: BryanLondon
Reviews.Content: I think the word "recherche" was coined to describe this hotel. Furnished in a period elegance (I would hate to have paid for the fabrics) it has an old-world ambience. OK, we had no TV in our room, but that's what we go on holiday to get away from. The hotel consists of three 17th century properties knocked into one, so there are lots of different levels. Amsterdam houses were taxed on their frontage, so stairs are steep and intimidating, but the breakfast room was a holiday in itself. The hotel is not suitable for the halt and the lame. (The blind should keep away from Amsterdam altogether because the canals have only low fencing.) Meanwhile, we loved the decor and the profusion of antiques (all regularly dusted!). The staff included representatives from Ireland and our native Yorkshire, and they made phone calls for us and provided tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great location, will go back”
Reviews.Author: ThinkSo
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a very charming place to stay. Our room was a nice size, and both very comfortable and very clean, and wonderfully decorated. The location of the hotel is excellent - a short stroll from the city centre, and just down the canal from the Anne Frank House. The people who work there are friendly and helpful, and kindly recommended restaurants, hair-dresser and places to go out. Having stayed in a number of places in Amsterdam, this is the one I go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisbiv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an awesome location! It is located on a quiet canal and near everything. The Anne Frank house is just around the corner. Our room was on the top floor facing the canal. The view was amazing. Our room was a bit smaller than others (by looking at the plan of the floor I could tell), the bathroom was pretty decent size. For me the only draw back was that I felt it coudl have been cleaner. I understand that the building is old and many of the pieces of furniture is old and are dust collectors, but I felt as if the bathroom, especially the shower could have had a bit more attention. Other than that, great location, wonderful room. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: llacour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and loved every minute of it. When I booked the room, they informed me the only room they had was with two single beds that they could put together facing the garden. I asked if they would please try and get us a canal view room and to our surprise we got one! The room was small and a little hard to get too (although that was part of the fun, especially after a night of eating, drinking and smoking) but it was perfect and made us feel like we were really getting the Amsterdam experience. The bed was very comfortable and bathroom was a nice size. My favorite part about the hotel was the location. It was in our favorite part of Amsterdam - a residential area away from Dam square. There were tons of amazing shop, restaurants and bars throughout the neighborhood. I would recommend the Greek restaurant right around the corner. So fun! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chris39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 4 nights with family and friends. Booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Afterwards slightly concerned that it would feel old and musty - I need'nt have worried. A warm friendly and inviting hotel in a wonderful location. We had 2 small double rooms (14&15)overlooking the canal, daughters in one and husband and I in other. Girls were worried about it feeling 'creepy', but after first night they felt very at home and safe as the rooms were so close together with no others nearby. Our friends had a fabulous large triple room looking over the back, room 19 and with a tv which pleased their 14 year old son. Looked forward every morning to breakfast in elegant breakfast room. Very friendly staff, nothing too much trouble. Hotel is convenient for good restaurants. Asked hotel for recommendations and was given a list. Our favourite was 'De Regeur' an old brown bar with bistro type feel. Cosy and candlelit. Food mid-range price and beautifully presented. Also ate at Belgian restaurant Leve (sp?), which was good. Liked the brown bar next door to this restaurant too. One of the hightlights of our stay was the Heineken Experience. Children loved it! Lots of interactive things to do including making a hilarious video of yourselves on a boat on a canal miming to 'tulips from Amsterdam', which you can e-mail to your delighted friends! Obviously did all the museums including the Anne Frank House which was very moving. Large queues all day for this. We recommend getting there by opening time at 9 o'clock at least which is fairly easy as it is only a 3 minute walk from hotel. Bicyle tour was a good trip. We chose the 'Yellow Bike' company. Beware that there is no time to get accustomed to bike before the tour guide is off crossing lanes of traffic and tram lines. If you pedal backwards then the break is activated (also one on handlebar). My 11 year old daughter could not get the hang of this straight away and was left behind with her father. Tour Guide did'nt even notice he was 2 missing! Did'nt see them until end of the 3 hour trip. Back to the Canal House. I would also mention the friendly and helpful reception staff. Cosy bar just off reception where there is a computer with free internet access. We were really sorry to leave, especially as our next stop was a large Novotel in Brussels.

Reviews.Title: “two different views”
Reviews.Author: susanna1875
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 6 and 7. We had a top floor room, without a view of nothing in particular, big bathroom, nice and clean. It was one of the quietest rooms I have stayed in in Europe. Our friends stayed for one night, in a room overlooking the gardens and they heard the church bells all night and didn't get a good nights rest, also their bed was extremely hard. I thought that I would just post both of our experiences since you really can have different things in different rooms. I really liked the hotel, nice staff, fab location, I'd stay again. I thought that the price was reasonable for Amsterdam @ 170E.

Reviews.Title: “very charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: NWOnt.
Reviews.Content: At the Canalhouse Hotel on Keizersgracht, you wonâ€™t find an air conditioner, safe, television or mini-fridge in your guest room. However, you will receive a fan, use of the safe at the reception, and ice from the lobby bar (no charge for any of these), as well as character, charm and antiques in abundance everywhere in the hotel. The location is excellent: walking distance everywhere, and we loved the evening glow on the canal from the setting sun. Our room (#19 which faced the rear of the hotel) was very large and bright, and included two massive windows, wing-back style couch and chair, and an antique desk. We enjoyed listening to the frequent ringing of the carillon from the nearby Westerkerk (church) and birds singing. Our favourite restaurants included the Pancake Bakery for excellent pannekoekens (crepes) and poffertjes (tiny pancakes), Haesje Claes and Keuken Van for traditional food, Kantijl en de Tijger for rijsttafel (Indonesian food with a minimum of 11 courses), and Patisserie Pompadour (the Huidenstraat 12 location) for exquisite chocolates and tostis (grilled cheese sandwiches). We also enjoyed smoked eel and vlaamse frites (french fries) with mayo from the street vendors. The Albert Hein supermarket has the best chocolate bars and speculaas (gingerbread cookies) which make unique souvenirs for family and friends back home. For attractions, we recommend the Bloemenmarkt (floating flower market) for a variety of gorgeous flowers (our trip was in June 2006); the Rijksmuseum; the Saturday antique market at the Noorderkerk (church); walking the charming elm-lined canals in the Jordaan district (where our hotel is located) and browsing through the antique, book, and bakery shops; and for something different, a quick jaunt through the Red Light District. We took day trips by train to Alkmaar and Delft. The weekly (Friday) cheese market in Alkmaar is rather â€œstagedâ€�. If you are interested in pottery, a visit to the DePorceleyne Fles (a factory) and the Lambert Van Meerten Museum in Delft are highly recommended. We enjoyed our day trip by bus to Marken and Volendam: the short ferry ride between these two small towns was relaxing, especially in the hot weather. During all these trips, we enjoyed the scenery of green pastures with grazing cows and sheep, the narrow canals, the occasional windmill, and peopleâ€™s immaculate looking homes with tiny, charming front-yard gardens and orange banners in support of the countryâ€™s participation in the world soccer games. We thoroughly enjoyed our one week trip in Amsterdam and the Canalhouse Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended at all”
Reviews.Author: ProDiver
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the Canal House, and I wish we had moved on after first seeing the rooms. Two of us had a double on the first floor, one of us had a single on the second. In both cases, the housekeeping was absolutley negligent--I have seen cleaner bathrooms on an airplane; carpets were filthy, and I wouldn't even want to think about the blankets! We asked to have the bath cleaned one afternoon, and that consisted of only replacing the towels. The staff seems to split housekeeping, front desk and breakfast room duty and there was not much interest in doing any one job particularly well. When we asked for kleenex, the girl at the front desk said they were out, and would I mind using a napkin?! Breakfast (included) was precisely the same every morning--boring bread, dull cheese etc. but atleast the hard boiled eggs were warm and fresh. Neighborhood is very nice--lots of good cafes, restaurants and shops around; also within walking distance to much of what you might want to visit. Public rooms in the hotel are pleasant, which is a very good thing. Believe me, we did not want to kill any time in our nasty bedrooms! Note: There is no staff at the hotel in the nighttime: in an emergency, phone calls to the hotel go to an answering machine which is checked at 7:00 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at budget price”
Reviews.Author: valaamot
Reviews.Content: My 12-year old son and I recently had a short stay at the Canal House. It was everything I had read about and more. We had a beautiful, spacious room (#24) overlooking a canal. It was very quiet (no TV, not missed) and private, with very comfortable beds. Breakfast included fresh, delicious fruit, wonderful breads, cheeses and meats, and pots of good coffee or hot chocolate. The staff was so gracious and accomodating--we were treated like royalty. The decor is absolutely stunning. The Canal House would be just as appropriate for a romantic getaway as it was for my family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: cailin-11
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the Canal House Hotel. We stayed just for one night as a stopover en route to Africa but we loved the hotel. When we arrived we were given a choice of room (either a canal view room or a larger room at the back of the hotel). We chose the larger room overlooking the garden. It was beautifully furnished and was very comfortable. The hotel is gorgeous and is a nice refreshing change from the "standard" hotel room that has become far too common. It has lovely character. We will definitely be planning a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “20 years of excellence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How often can you say that a hotel gives the same excellent standards when your visits are 20 years apart ? OK so maybe a 20 year gap is a bit unusual but in our case both trips were for very special reasons. The first, 20 years ago in April 1986 for our honeymoon. In those days we really couldn't afford much but having decided on taking out a small loan, my husband surprised me with a trip to the Canal House the day after we got married. It's true ladies, the romantic fellas still exist, honest. A limo picked us up from the airport (another surprise) & whisked us off to the Kaisergracht where we were met with a very warm welcome from our American hosts. Elegance, friendly smiles, lots of laughs & wonderful service kept the place high on our list of fond memories. 20 years later,in April 2006, we decided to celebrate our 20th anniversary with a return trip. This time, money was not so tight so we could afford to really relax & enjoy the Canal House experience to its full extent. We utilised the services of the recommended driver, Mario (an excellent choice) to collect us at the airport & arranged for him to take us back on the last day too. It felt so good to be back. To see the hotel had changed so little in it's elegant & timeless decor, with the gilt & marble still there, was a wonderful nostalgia trip. The new owners have ensured that the same warmth & friendship greets all guests & we instantly felt relaxed & welcome. The hotel has since been extended so we had a large airy room with the trademark traditional decor that helped us feel as though we were in a typically dutch home. The staff make a point of being helpful & we were always greeted with a smile from breakfast to evenings. Having travelled quite a lot in the past 20 years, in our opinion, the Canal House offers a standard of comfort that you would be hard pushed to find elsewhere for the money. We both look forward to visiting again as soon as we can for short breaks & to catch up with everyone there, including the cat !

Reviews.Title: “Full of Original Character”
Reviews.Author: Brian Q.
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night for a weekend break but excellent welcome on arrival at 10am.Able to leave bags at reception whilst going for 1st walkabout.Their advert says living in the 17th Century and they have certainly retained that feeling with furnishings etc.Staff all very friendly & helpful.We had room 14a on 2nd floor overlooking canal but high enough to be away from road noise.Beamed ceilings & brilliant view.There is a lift as far as 2nd floor (not to attic room) but you still have to use a few stairs to most rooms.Pricey but has good Quality.Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last October. We didn't intend paying 150 Euros per night (though you can't find many decent hotels in Amsterdam for much less), but were swayed by the positive reviews of other Trip Advisor Members. We stayed in a room overlooking the garden which was warm, clean and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the buffet breakfast was pretty good too. That breakfast room is just fantastic! The location is pretty good, with ample parking spots for bicycles (I really recommend hiring a bike to tour the city. It's the fastest, cheapest and most thrilling way to see this glorious city). If you don't mind the steep price I unhesitantly recommend this hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home to the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: KCBostonUSA
Reviews.Content: Fully and elegantly furnished (including grand piano in dining room) recently renovated hotel in a 17th century canal house in the heart of Amsterdam, near Dam Square, Jordaan and Central Station. This hotel has an excellent staff available. Our housekeeper was Lynn, who also served breakfast in the dining room. Ever cheerful, she gave the Canal House its heart. In Herenstraat, just opposite the hotel, you will find a great bistro for fresh orange juice and croissants for breakfast and croque monsieur for lunch (terrace on the canal). Furthermore you will find a drugstore, florist, a shoemaker, several antique shops and restaurants, ranging from good food (including Greek and French) to great cuisine. The house is a 10 minute walk to Dam Square, 20 minutes to the Central Station and a two minute walk to the nearest canal boat stop (several to choose from getting you to all the museums). Ann Frank house is just around the corner in this very quiet, peaceful neighborhood. Entertainment is abounding. From the tacky (Amsterdam Dungeon... quite fun, actually) to the cultural (how about a quintet concert for 10 Euro?). Canal House gives you a true feel to Amsterdam, with a touch of the 17th century.

Reviews.Title: “Magic in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: californiagirl1955
Reviews.Content: I love Amsterdam.One of the things I love most is the Canalhouse.I have tried three other hotels but after staying at the Canalhouse I would never stay any place else.In the past three years I have stayed there four times.It is a beautiful old canalhouse in the most beautiful area.What makes it extra special are the people who work there.They are all so friendly,warm and helpful.I love waking up and going downstairs to the beautiful breakfast room looking out on the garden.The food is delicious and the pots of hot coffee and tea always a great way to start my day.I am always greeted with the warmest and sincerest "goodmornings".All of the people at the front desk are so sweet and helpful with any questions I might have or help I might need with anything.I have traveled alot in Asia,North and South America and Europe and I can honestly say that the Canalhose is a Very Special place to stay.I always recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “bitterly disapointedby canal house”
Reviews.Author: weavil
Reviews.Content: Tired busy parents of young children ,we planned with care our weekend break in amsterdam,the extraordinarly highly recommended canal house was available we were delighted .Our experience was marred by an extremly noisy canal side room awake all night!We requested a room change nonchalantly recieved and done we retuned sat pm to a hideous room in the attic where the booming church clock woke us every 15 mins throuh the night.NO one enquired as to whether, we were now more comfortable ,breakfast was mediocre coffee weak and luke warm.We were leaving early on monday i.e 7ish we were offered nothing by way of refreshment .Rooms are supposed to be priced individually! So on leaving we had a very sour feeling as the rate we had agreed on booking was disputed we paid alot more.Staff are relying on the splendid location and preservation issues aside the decor is tired and uncomfortable as we were on departure

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: romaboots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canal House in Sept. 2002 and are planning on returning in June 2005. This is a beautiful, old world hotel with lovely rooms. We had an upper floor room overlooking the canal with a spacious sitting area, large bathroom and comfortable queen size bed. At night, we laid in bed and watched the full moon and cloud formations. The hotel has a charming bar where we enjoyed appertifs and the breakfast room is elegant with a grand piano and overlooks a nice garden. The food was an excellent way to start the day. The service was superb and the hotel is centrally located so we walked everywhere and enjoyed the sights, shops and coffe shops. The staff provided us with excellent restaurant recommendations and we enjoyed Indonesian and other fine restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. We highly recommend the Canal House and advise asking for a room on the canal side as the views really made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “location is key”
Reviews.Author: Jhouston1971
Reviews.Content: I would have liked this hotel better if I'd had a room above the 1st level. We faced the canal, but the level of the hotel room was only about 4'-5' higher than the street. Because it was warm, we kept the windows open and were therefore subjected to some noise from the street. And it didn't feel as private as what a room on an upper floor would have. Therefore, I would recommend making sure you get a room above the 2nd level facing the canal. I think the location is this hotel's greatest draw, on a terrific canal and adjacent to the Jordaan, which I find to be Amsterdam's most desirable area. The rooms are basic - don't expect luxury. And you won't find tv's or air conditioning. The breakfasts are a nice way to start the day and the staff is friendly and accomodating. I'd stay here again, but with a room on a higher level.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, great service and perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Lyb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 10, which is one of 3 rooms that the elevator doesn't reach, but that just made it even more charming. When I got to the hotel, the reception was very friendly, giving me a map and marking where the hotel was in relation to everything else. She told me that they would get my suitcase up to my room, which had gotten quite heavy since it was at the end of a 2 week trip. There were 2 different ways to get to my room, one which you took the elevator up to 2 floors and then had to go through some corridors and then down a typical canal house staircases, or the other which you had to go up 2 of those staircases. I usually took the 2 staircases up and when I left early on Sunday morning, before all the staff had arrived, I simply slid my suitcase down the staircases, no problem. I had a room with a canal view and it was as wonderful at night as it was during the day. The hotel's location is great, ideally located just a few minutes from Anne Frank House, several restaurants, yet it wasn't overly busy. I liked my room very much, both the room and the bathroom were extremely clean. The breakfast, which is included, was plentiful and served in a very elegant room. The overall experience of staying at this hotel was absolutely wonderful. I most definitely would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone who went to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Canal House for five days in the spring of this year. The hotel was one of the highlights of our stay in Amsterdam. The ambience was perfect - very charming, personable staff, and well-appointed decor. We stayed in a small upstairs room overlooking the rooftoops of the city. The room was quaint, clean, and nicely decorated. The bathroom was larger than we expected with a bathtub. We bought some tulips at the flower market and were pleased to find a glass pitcher in the room to use as a vase, which brightened up the space. The room was very quiet and timeless. The only sounds we heard were the melody of the local church bells serenading us to sleep and adding to the charm. Breakfast was a wonderful affair we looked forward to each morning. The breakfast room is beautiful, bright and relaxed, and the buffet selection is one of the best I've seen in a European hotel of this class. The waitstaff were very pleasant and efficient. The bar is small, but cozy, with a lovely selection of local guidebooks -- not a place to spend the evening, but perfect for a drink before heading out, or to meet fellow travelers. We took a glass of wine each evening in the bar before going to dinner. The hotel posts a list of recommended area restaurants and the staff booked all of our reservations. We were not disappointed with any we tried and particularly recommend the Indonesian restaurant -- our favorite dinner during our stay! The staff was very helpful. We wanted to take a day excursion to the countryside and the hotel staff member on duty spent a lot of time helping us decide where to go and suggesting places to see. She also allowed us to borrow one of the hotel's many guidebooks for our trip. The location could not have been better. It is on a canal in a very quiet, but beautiful location and easily within walking distance or a short tram ride to all the museums and sites. There are canal bus stops nearby as well - one across the canal at the square and the other by the Anna Frank House. We wandered around the neighborhood on foot and really enjoyed seeing a quieter side of the city. We absolutely loved our stay! This is not a hotel for those who want luxurious, modern or American-style amenities. As one reviewer commented, the bathtub does not have a shower curtain -- but that is because this is a European style hotel and, after all, is in Europe. You will not find large modern rooms, televisions, coffee pots and mini-bars, or be in the heart of Amsterdam night life. But, that is precisely what we liked about it - peaceful and historic ambience. My husband's only complaint was that the crowd was older (we are in our late 20's), but I preferred the less rowdy company. Canal House has old-world charm, character and a peaceful ambience, in a quiet but convenient location and is reasonable for what it offers. If that is what you are looking for, I recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at your granny's”
Reviews.Author: sohersu
Reviews.Content: Well, above everything i read before my boyfriend and i stayed there, i must say that i never stayed in a hotel in Amsterdam, my boyfriend's family owns a house on the same canal and it's pretty much the same but RESTORED, which is something that this hotel should do soon! We stayed there to go to a funeral & there was not much left to be booked in the city centre. We got in really late and it took me a while to fall sleep, it was not dirty, but it felt like sleeping in my grandparents bed... It's alright that they keep the old furniture but the mattress should be changed, it was way too soft, my back still hurts! It's not luxury old, it's just old. It was an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed blessings”
Reviews.Author: mm2003
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely a mixed bag and I was very disappointed after all the rave reviews. We stayed for three nights on our first trip to Amsterdam in November 2004 and had requested a room with a city view--what we got was an attic room with rooftop views. When we were there a local church bell kept us awake all night long...I know that sounds really cool, european and romantic, but it was every 15 minutes and really loud even with the windows closed. There was a pretty nice room that we peeked into at the end of our hall that was larger and nicely appointed with many windows. Shower Bath tub in our room was a tub only. It had a typical European showerhead-on-a-hose which was fine, but it did not have a tub enclosure so that you could not do a "stand up" shower--my wife found this to be a real pain for shampooing her hair and one tended to get really cold when wet. Furnishings could be described as "old world antique" if you wanted to be overly generous. In reality the furnishings were old, tattered and shabby. One couple from our group had a street/canal front room, which was much larger and nicer. Some street noise, but not bad, and had a canal view across the street. We were told by some employees that the owners are not local and have not put a dime into the place since they bought it several years ago and it shows it. Management / front office staff seemed cold and indifferent. On the plus side: Location is really very good. Work staff is friendly. Breakfast room, garden view and breakfast foods are A++.
