The off-lobby bar is old world cool and a great place to hang out and have a drink. All-in-all we would not stay at Canal House again. Amsterdam was interesting, but not high on my list to return to. The Anne Frank house is not to be missed and very close to Canal House if you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GaryThomas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here maybe 5 or 6 times and I love it. No two rooms are the same. The breakfast room is wonderful, the bar is somewhere you actually might want to have a drink in, and the location great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Tired room.”
Reviews.Author: JanSurfCity_NJ
Reviews.Content: Booked a night while we waited for our houseboat to become available. The staff was very helpful and friendly. the location was excellent. We loved the proximity to the charming Jordaan neighborhood. Great nearby restaurants! We were at the Ann Frank House as it opened - a good thing, as it is small and not air-conditioned (but worth every moment). Our bedroom was quite large, but more than a little tired. The bathroom was small and depressing. The glories of this hotel are the public rooms. The large and beautiful parlor took me to another era. The bar was charming. The view of the rear garden was delightful. I would stay in this neighborhood again, but I think I might go up one more star to get a more updated facility.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: marywoodall
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Canal House for 4 days in early June and thought it was delightful. Our room was just off the breakfast room and looked out into an interior courtyard. We could get plenty of fresh air and light. The staff was helpful and we appreciated the giant map of local restaurants posted in the reception area. Breakfast was served in a beautiful room and was very good. The location of the Canal House is perfect: just a few blocks from the Anne Frank House and the Westerkirk. The streetcar was nearby for daily excursions and there were also plenty of local cafes for lunch and dinner. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the hype”
Reviews.Author: Anne011
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews about this hotel we were unpleasantly surprised to find it so below par. Even for an old hotel the rooms were incredibly noisy -- you could hear the entire conversations of folks in the next room; the bed was so soft and lumpy that it was hard to sleep; the rooms were smoky; and the staff didn't seem very knowledgeable about tourist opportunities in Amsterdam, such as museum discounts. All the staff were extremely pleasant and cordial, and the place certainly had a certain charm, but we wouldn't stay here again. The location is ideal, though -- very centrally located and with lots of cafes and shops in the areas. I will say that which room you get does seem to make a difference, so it does pay to ask about other rooms if yours is not to your liking.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Amsterdam Experience”
Reviews.Author: EugeneQueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canal House for 5 night in April, 2005. This was my fourth trip to Amsterdam, and my second stay at the Canal House, and I would never stay in a big hotel. The small hotel experience with a canal location is particularly perfect in Amsterdam. The views from the canal front rooms are wonderful, the beds are comfortable and the furniture in character with the kind of hotel that it is. The Crown Jewel of the hotel is the breakfast room and the staff who attend it. The food is very good, as is the service and the ambience of the room. We were in the bar area most evenings for a glass of wine and just enjoyed the common area. It gave us an opportunity to talk with other travelers. There can be stairs involved to get to your room and they are extremely steep. If this would be a problem for you, it would be good to discuss this at the time of booking. Will we stay there again ---- Yes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: suzbailey
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the reviews here for our 2 night stay in early May 2005 and we were not disappointed. We had room #11, which was difficult to reach down small spiral stairs and was a bit worn, but I suppose that is part of the charm of this lovely bed and breakfast. We had a view of the canal and enjoyed watching boats pass by. The breakfast room is beautifully decorated and the staff was friendly and helpful. Don't miss the Pancake Bakery around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Just love it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this so lovely hotel for 4 nights and I can't find the words to express my admiration. Great location, great rooms, personnel and everyting around even if you don't have canal view room (we didn't). I don't understand someone's regrets: no TV or teamaker... Who is missing TV in such amazing place as Amsterdam is? I recommend this hotel honestly as I chose it only reading other people's reviews on this website. One more suggestion: Tripadvisor's rate is two stars while the hotel is three-star. J.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: MKKim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of April and had a fantastic time. The hotel is close to the tram stop at Westepark and Anne Frank's House. The rooms are very pretty although there are no tea & coffee making facilities which would be handy. There is also no TV - bear this in mind if you like to keep in touch with the news etc. The breakfast was very nice - buffet style with lots of choice and the staff were friendly. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel if you want somewhere a little different from the usual chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “olde worlde opulence”
Reviews.Author: theoriginalsid
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Canal House twice and love it but have to concede that it is an acquired taste. It isn't cheap but is a truly special place to stay -- like taking a stroll back in time. The location is perfect, on a quiet canal, near all the sights (Dam square, Ann Frank house etc) and near the Jordaan area which is chock-full of excellent bars and restaurants. Do not stay there if you want a minibar, a TV in your room, 24-hr room service, breakfast in bed etc as you won't get it. It is a very atmospheric place to sleep but not good for much else -- this isn't a criticism, just a statement of fact. Breakfast is fairly standard European: bread and cold cuts or cheese, cereals, croissants, boiled eggs and (tinned) fruit. The breakfast room ambience is amazing though. Staff are very helpful and attentive, as are the owners and receptionist. There is one lift and the corridors are very windy and twisty and the staircases VERY steep so anyone who is 'mobility-impaired' would have a big problem. The rooms I've had have both been full of antiques and had four-poster beds but are not modern -- as I said no TV though a radio. Bathrooms are a bit tired with 70s tiled decor (half-size bathtub) but are more than adequate. The bar is not a place to while away the hours -- not enough seating for more than two groups, closes at 22.30 -- more somewhere to grab a glass of wine or a beer before going out and yes, it is a bit chintzy but heck, you have the whole of the city to choose from . Make sure you settle your bill in cash to qualify for the 5% discount and to help them with their cashflow. This review may sound a bit negative it isn't intended to be so; it is simply to prevent you going with the wrong expectations since the CH's recent billing as a HIP HOTEL might make it appeal to the wrong crowd, which would be a pity for those of us who are the 'right' crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic weekend away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam a number of times before, we decided to stay somewhere a little more "grown-up" and this wonderful hotel fit the bill. The location is excellent - just down the canal from the Anne Frank house, on tramlines, and a short walk from Dam Square. The staff were friendly and helpful. I was looking for a hairdresser appointment, and the girl at the reception desk phoned a number of places to find me an appointment. There is a list of recommended local restaurants, and the staff will provide additional information on any. We tried a few, and were happy with each. The hotel itself has old-world charm, that seems very authentic - an airy, open, warm breakfast room, a cosy, friendly bar and wonderful, romantic, individually styled rooms. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Sanctuary in a City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Canal House. First, we loved the location. The canals are beautiful - day or night. The area was quiet and lovely at night. The interior of the hotel is lovely and the staff there was very friendly, helpful, warm and welcoming. Our room was on the garden side and aside from being clean, it was roomy and sweetly decorated. The bathroom was very nice as well. The only addition I would have liked is bedside lamps for reading. The breakfast was lovely, plenty of delicious food and the diningroom was very beautiful. We'll absolutely return to The Canal House.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room a bit 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: turtlez
Reviews.Content: After reading many great things about the Canal House we decided it was the place for us on our recent visit to Amsterdam. The hotel has a great location, the antique furnishings are wonderful to look at, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a lovely view, since our room faced the canal. But all-in-all I would have to say that we were expecting more for our Euros (the room was not cheap). Our room was small and we had to take care not to hit our heads on the sloping beams (which were charming, but difficult to maneuver around) while trying not to trip over the bed. The carpet was thin and spotted. The bed was a small double and we had no space for our luggage. The bathroom was also small with a sloping ceiling, making it difficult to stand upright in the shower (which had moldy grout and odd wooden swinging doors). The towels were thin (one was torn) and the toilet took at least 30 minutes to refill. It just looked like the room had seen better days and needed an update. Many people have commented about the breakfasts. Yes, the room it is served in is beautiful, but the food is only average, both in quality and variety. Would we stay there again? Probably not, as there seem to be many other small canal house hotels to try in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PerpetualTraveller
Reviews.Content: This would have to be one of the most charming hotels we have stayed at. I stayed at Canal House some 20 years ago with my parents on a trip to Amsterdam and coming back again this month was like a trip down memory lane. The hotel has retained the same charm and cosiness. The room was very spacious with a view of the garden at the rear of the hotel. The room and bathroom was well appointed and comfortable. The rooms do not have TVs which was not missed. The breakfast spread was generous and the quality of food excellent. The staff were extremely courteous and attentive. The ambience of the grand old room was a good start to a day of touring around the city. In room tea and coffee making facilities including a small fridge would have been appreciated but this should not deter anyone from making a reservation. Having stayed at this hotel two times over so many years I would not hesitate staying there on future visits to Amsterdam. I am surprised that some contributors were disappointed with the hotel, however it is no secret the hotel is old and this is part of the charm of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Unspoilt 200 year old Amsterdam Houses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Absolutely nothing bad to say about it. Excellent staff from the receptionists to the waitresses at breakfast. Just the right distance from the city centre and near Anna Frank's House. We can't wait to stay again in a few years time

Reviews.Title: “Did we stay at the same place?”
Reviews.Author: Joysafina
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...I was very disappointed. After reading all the reviews, we booked here. The hotel was in a lovely neighborhood, very quaint, the hotel had a lot of charm. But, the room was poor. Maybe we just had bad luck and didn't get the 'renovated' rooms I keep reading about. But our room was in dire need of remodeling. There is a difference between old Amsterdam - and simply old. This room was dusty and dirty and the bathroom was not modern at all. The breakfast was good though and the Irish staff were very nice. I wouldn't stay here again for this price - sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great service”
Reviews.Author: DocAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: All the review are correct. This is a wonderful bed and breakfast in a very beauthiful part of Amsterdam. Location is excellent and staff is always there to help.

Reviews.Title: “April 2004 stay”
Reviews.Author: ButlerFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in mid-april 2004. Exceeded every expectation I had. From the moment we arrived until we left I was thrilled. We had two rooms each of them were clean and well appointed. Both rooms had been recently re-done and re-done well. The complimentily breaksfast was perferct and solved the problem of where to eat early. Great location and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, elegant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam, and I was delighted to find this jewel for my hotel. The Canal House was once a typical canal mansion. The interior is beautiful, marble walls and floors, chandeliers, antiques. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a little small in American standards, but that's okay -- we were in Europe. The location was great. Just around the corner from Anne Frank's house and from the Jordaan - an area of interesting shops and restaurants. We walked to all of the sites in Amsterdam and enjoyed the calmness of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Canal House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Canal House is a gem of a hotel and is very nicely located-very near the Anne Frank House and an easy walk to the trams and bus line. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the staff friendly, the breakfast very nice, the rooms very large, and the price fairly reasonable. They gave us 2 rooms (one master and one with twin beds) that were in a nice little section all closed off from the rest of the rooms and almost like private quarters. The price they gave us was E 150 per night for each. The master looked out over the canal. Both were done in old style but the bathrooms, while continental in appearance, were newly done-clean and efficient. Be advised, however, that there are a lot of steps (steep and narrow) to some of the rooms, like ours, that are very difficult to negotiate with a lot of luggage, like ours! Was well worth the lugging!!! Loved it and would highly recommend it to anyone. Would definitely stay there again if the opportunity presented itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great character, quiet but convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time (usually too much) finding the "right" hotel when I travel. For Amsterdam I decided that to get a real feel for the charm of this city, I'd need to get a house on a canal (thus the name of this hotel). I think I found my place! This hotel is on a quiet street, right on a beautiful canal, in a beautiful area. The hotel itself is very well-kept and somewhat old-fashioned (I'm guessing it's very Dutch). The included breakfast buffet was very good. My canal-view room was a bit small but was all I needed; I believe there are larger rooms. You can get to most of the popular areas in about a 10-20 minute walk and there is a lot of transportation and buses nearby. The staff was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable with directions and things to do (they even pointed me towards a "coffee house" when I asked). All in all, a great place that I'd recommend if you're looking for this type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “character”
Reviews.Author: doremifaso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canal House last August and it is indeed in a superb location in a lovely quiet spot right by, yes, a canal. Despite the location being peaceful and safe it was nonetheless central to everything and there are some nice shops/bars/eateries in the vacinity of Kaizergracht-the canal where it is situated and Prisengracht-the next one along. It is eclectically decorated and looks intriguing. The bar isn't really somewhere to spend an hour or two-we went there once for a drink and it felt a bit like being in your aunt's parlour-but then you do have Amsterdam to explore. This isn't a cheap hotel, but then if you want somehting even half way decent in amsterdam you will pay a bit more than some other European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay when visiting Amsterdam. Have visited 2X and each time was a treat. Would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wonderful quality hotel.Very polite,well informed staff.easy access to the city.have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Canal House last week and loved it! The neighborhood of the western canal ring is the most atmospheric part of the city, and the Canal House is right there. We booked two and a half months ahead for a canal view room in mid-October, when the weather was crisp in temperature but we were blessed with four straight days of sunshine. The canal view room was small but cozy, and the compromise in room area was worth it to us because we were constantly peeking out the window to admire the view. It was a delight to wake up on our final morning and see a duck swimming past with the ripples in its wake expanding to the canal walls! It was only on my fourth trip to Amsterdam that I finally got a room with a view--and at a reasonable price for the city. The bonus is that Canal House has plenty of atmosphere and a nice brunch in a delightful dining room with the flavor of Golden Age Amsterdam. Also, the service is professional and helpful. I would definitely return for another stay at the Canal House on a future visit to Amsterdam, especially if I plan ahead enough again to get another room with a canal view.

HotelInfo.Name: Canal House
HotelInfo.Address: Keizersgracht 148, Amsterdam 1015 CX, The Netherlands
